results.title: Ping Pong
results.brief_description: Ping Pong is a 2002 sports film directed by Japanese filmmaker Fumihiko Sori. It is based on Taiyō Matsumoto’s manga of the same name and is about the friendship between two high school table tennis players.

constellations_other.name: The first home console and the art of ping pong
constellations_other.description: An exploration of tennis and ping pong throughout the moving image.

results.description: As children, the introverted Smile was being bullied by a gang of kids until the brash Peco comes by and chases all of them them away. Peco then takes Smile under his wings and teaches him how to play the game of ping pong. From there a life long best friend relationship comes into existence between these two polar opposite kids. Fast forward a decade later, these two best friends try to deal with their own inner turmoils, as they move further and further into the regional ping pong tournament. Peco has to overcome a knee injury while trying to rediscover the fun aspects of the game of Ping Pong. Meanwhile, Smile now seems to have gained the killer instinct by going through a rigorous training regiment instilled by his high school coach. As the tournament progresses it becomes more likely that these two best friends will face off against each in the final match.
description_for_label: As children, the introverted Smile was being bullied by a gang of kids until the brash Peco comes by and chases all of them them away. As the tournament progresses it becomes more likely that these two best friends will face off against each in the final match.

results.title: Pierrot le Fou
results.brief_description: Pierrot escapes his boring society and travels from Paris to the Mediterranean Sea with Marianne, a girl chased by hit-men from Algeria. They lead an unorthodox life, always on the run in Jean-Luc Goddard’s 1965 French New Wave classic.

constellations_other.name: All about Agnes
constellations_other.description: Belgian director Agnes Varda was the only female director in the French New Wave movement and is known for her long career across influential documentary and dramas, and for her trademark humour, curiosity and insight.

constellations_other.name: Gunslingers, good fellas and flea bags
constellations_other.description: Explore how a 1903 western changed the course of filmmaking and videogames by breaking the fourth wall.

results.description: Pierrot escapes his boring society and travels from Paris to the Mediterranean Sea with Marianne, a girl chased by hit-men from Algeria. They lead an unorthodox life, always on the run in Jean-Luc Goddard’s 1965 French New Wave classic.

results.title: Picnic at Hanging Rock
results.brief_description: Valentine’s Day, 1900. Three schoolgirls and their governess mysteriously disappear in Hanging Rock, Australia, without a trace.

constellations_other.name: Clothing, country, character
constellations_other.description: Edie Kurzer's costume design work on Judy & Punch and Picnic at Hanging Rock is part of a larger trend in Australian films and TV series.

constellations_other.name: Inspired design and costume sketches
constellations_other.description: Costume designers Edie Kurzer and Alice Babidge have worked on some of the most acclaimed Australian and international films and TV, joining the ranks of fellow Australians creatives.

results.description: Valentine’s Day, 1900. Three schoolgirls and their governess mysteriously disappear in Hanging Rock, Australia, without a trace.

results.title: Picnic at Hanging Rock
results.brief_description: Peter Weir’s Australian New Wave classic about a group of students who mysteriously disappear as an eerie but scenic volcanic formation called Hanging Rock.

constellations_other.name: Clothing, country, character
constellations_other.description: Edie Kurzer's costume design work on Judy & Punch and Picnic at Hanging Rock is part of a larger trend in Australian films and TV series.

constellations_other.name: Inspired design and costume sketches
constellations_other.description: Costume designers Edie Kurzer and Alice Babidge have worked on some of the most acclaimed Australian and international films and TV, joining the ranks of fellow Australians creatives.

results.description: In the early 1900s, Miranda attends a girls boarding school in Australia. One Valentine’s Day, the school’s typically strict headmistress treats the girls to a picnic field trip to an unusual but scenic volcanic formation called Hanging Rock. Despite rules against it, Miranda and several other girls venture off. It’s not until the end of the day that the faculty realizes the girls and one of the teachers have disappeared mysteriously.

results.title: Phoenix
results.brief_description: A disfigured concentration-camp survivor, unrecognizable after facial reconstruction surgery, searches ravaged postwar Berlin for the husband who might have betrayed her to the Nazis.

constellations_other.name: Reflecting duality and revealing new realities
constellations_other.description: The Toupie Fantoche relies on four prismatic mirrors to reflect changes in animation states.

results.description: A disfigured concentration-camp survivor, unrecognizable after facial reconstruction surgery, searches ravaged postwar Berlin for the husband who might have betrayed her to the Nazis.

results.title: Peter Rabbit
results.brief_description: Peter Rabbit’s feud with Mr. McGregor escalates to greater heights than ever before as they rival for the affections of the warm-hearted animal lover who lives next door.

constellations_other.name: Flipping through the evolution of animation
constellations_other.description: Animation has come a long way since flip books were popular. These optical toys gave the illusion of movement, but now whole films and special effects are animated entirely through computers.

results.description: Peter Rabbit’s feud with Mr. McGregor escalates to greater heights than ever before as they rival for the affections of the warm-hearted animal lover who lives next door.

results.title: Perfect Match
results.brief_description: Perfect Match is an Australian dating game show based on the format of The Dating Game. Perfect Match was produced by the Reg Grundy Organisation.

constellations_other.name: Australian TV in the 1980s
constellations_other.description: Australian television in the 80s really began to find its footing with mainstream hits becoming landmarks of the industry.

results.description:
Perfect Match is an Australian dating game show based on the format of The Dating Game. Perfect Match was produced by the Reg Grundy Organisation.

It originally aired on Network Ten for 30 minutes most weekdays from 5:30pm between 1984 and 1989. The format was revived in Australia for subsequent programs Blind Date based on its US counterpart in 1991, and again a revised version of Perfect Match this time airing on the Seven Network in 2002.
description_for_label:
Perfect Match is an Australian dating game show based on the format of The Dating Game. Perfect Match was produced by the Reg Grundy Organisation.

It originally aired on Network Ten for 30 minutes most weekdays from 5:30pm between 1984 and 1989. The format was revived in Australia for subsequent programs Blind Date based on its US counterpart in 1991, and again a revised version of Perfect Match this time airing on the Seven Network in 2002.

results.title: Penny Dreadful
results.brief_description: Some of literature’s most terrifying characters, including Dr. Frankenstein, Dorian Gray, and iconic figures from the novel Dracula are lurking in the darkest corners of Victorian London. Penny Dreadful is a frightening psychological thriller that weaves together these classic horror origin stories into a new adult drama.

constellations_other.name: The Lumière brothers
constellations_other.description: The Lumière brothers understood the potential of cinema to be exhibited theatrically. Only one person could watch films through Thomas Edison's Kinetograph, while Auguste and Louis exhibited their films to thousands with Cinematographe.

results.description: Some of literature’s most terrifying characters, including Dr. Frankenstein, Dorian Gray, and iconic figures from the novel Dracula are lurking in the darkest corners of Victorian London. Penny Dreadful is a frightening psychological thriller that weaves together these classic horror origin stories into a new adult drama.

results.title: Pearl Harbor
results.creator_credit: Jerry Bruckheimer Films, Touchstone Pictures, Michael Kaplan, Michael Bay, Jerry Bruckheimer, Pat Sandston, Randall Wallace, Nigel Phelps, K.C. Hodenfield, Kenny Bates, Mitzi Haralson and Jennifer Klein
results.brief_description: The lifelong friendship between Rafe McCawley and Danny Walker is put to the ultimate test when the two ace fighter pilots become entangled in a love triangle with beautiful Naval nurse Evelyn Johnson. But the rivalry between the friends-turned-foes is immediately put on hold when they find themselves at the center of Japan’s devastating attack on Pearl Harbor on Dec. 7, 1941.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jerry Bruckheimer Films, Touchstone Pictures, Michael Kaplan, Michael Bay, Jerry Bruckheimer, Pat Sandston, Randall Wallace, Nigel Phelps, K.C. Hodenfield, Kenny Bates, Mitzi Haralson and Jennifer Klein

results.title: Paris, Texas
results.headline_credit: France, Germany, United Kingdom and United States of America, 1984
results.brief_description: Travis Henderson (Harry Dean Stanton) wanders out of the desert not knowing who he is in Wim Wenders’ Palme d’Or-winning film. Henderson’s brother, Walt (Dean Stockwell) finds him, and helps to recover the memory of the life Travis led before he walked out on his family and disappeared four years earlier.

constellations_other.name: When music speaks
constellations_other.description: Some characters or moments are expressed more intensely through a musical motif than dialogue or action.
